problem.markdown:
According to Raffi, 1 tweet is equivalent to 140 characters, which is approximately 200 bytes. How could this limitation affect international tweeting? (x) Different languages can express different size sentences in the same amount of space. ( ) 140 characters is not enough for a single sentence in some languages. ( ) 140 characters allows to much space to write in
[explanation] In languages such as Chinese, a singe word can be represented by a single character. This means that a Twitter user in China could have more content in his tweet than say a Twitter user in the US. [explanation]
